remarks: This somewhat non-intuitive theorem tells us the value of its function is the empty set when the class ` C ` it would otherwise map to is a proper class.  This is a technical lemma that can help eliminate redundant sethood antecedents otherwise required by ~ fvmptg . (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2003.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2013.)
statement:
fvmptn.1 $e |- ( x = D -> B = C ) $.
fvmptn.2 $e |- F = ( x e. A |-> B ) $.
fvmptn $p |- ( -. C e. _V -> ( F ` D ) = (/) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d C x $.
$d D x $.
